author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of Israel's blistering strikes in fair Lebanon, I sing,
Where now echoes of fear within the heart's chamber do ring.
In the shadow of conflict, lo, sectarian strife springs,
As the militant dragon of Hezbollah unfurls its wings.

Upon Taiwan, Beijing's baleful glance is cast all day,
While the isle to the trumpet's call must nimbly obey.
Yet heavy lies the purse, and more her worry does weigh,
In Trump's wake, can Taiwan the daunting price defray?

Lends Trump his hand to the peace of Ukraine, fair and bright,
As Europe nods, keen to eschew the foul frost of fight.
In the chessboard of power, it is diplomacy's plight,
To steer the embattled ship of Kyiv through the night.

feedItems.title: Israeli Strikes in Lebanon Stir Fears of Sectarian Strife
feedItems.description: Lebanon’s religious fault lines are straining as Israel’s war with the Hezbollah militant group grinds on.

feedItems.title: As Beijing Threatens, Taiwan Looks Nervously at Trump
feedItems.description: The president-elect pressed Taiwan during his campaign to spend significantly more to defend against the growing threat of attack by China. Some in Taiwan say it can’t afford to spend what Donald Trump demands.

feedItems.title: Trump's Push for Ukraine Peace Finds Growing Acceptance in Europe
feedItems.description: With U.S. support for Kyiv in doubt, many European officials see diplomacy as the best option for Ukraine.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
With Putin's gaze of scorn, 'neath thunderous cloud they mourn,
A wolf's reply to peace-bird's song, a costly pact is worn.
Ukrainian soil, embattled, kissed by iron and flame,
In the brook, reflects a heart, in the cockerel's name.

Blade cuts air in eastern land, where knowledge blooms unfettered,
Eight souls lost in twisted dance, a garden's joy is shattered.
An unseen snail, in quiet course, can havoc cause, endeavour,
Ask the rose who feels its trace, silent but for ever.

In gymnast's world, a comet passed, Karolyi takes his leave,
Yet under brilliance of his trail, a rabbit's mark we grieve.
A goal earned with the whip's sting, or the carrots fair allure,
Tales spun in gyre and tumble, in truth's light, endure.

feedItems.title: As Western Leaders Look to Talks With Putin, Russia Launches Massive Barrage on Ukraine
feedItems.description: Ukrainian officials said the attack looked like an emphatic response by Russian President Vladimir Putin to moves from Kyiv’s allies to seek a peace deal.

feedItems.title: Eight Killed in Knife Attack at Chinese College
feedItems.description: The assault at a college in eastern China is the latest in a string of grisly crimes to unsettle the country.

feedItems.title: Gymnastics Coach Bela Karolyi Dies at 82
feedItems.description: Bela Karolyi rose to fame with Nadia Comaneci and a string of American stars, but he was also accused of contributing to a culture of abuse through his coaching methods.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In China's waters, a quarrel doth rise,
Two great ships 'neath the eastern skies.
Commending the law, or so they disguise,
’Tis but wine in a chalice of lies.

Xi to Biden, a pledge did make,
"Let’s sow peace where there's strife to stakе."
But in this game, nary a handshake,
Is free from the tug of give-and-take.

The host of COP29, in scornful jest,
Praises the fuel that fails the test.
Clouds do gather at his behest,
With the saint of climate hardly impressed.

feedItems.title: China's Heavyweight Coast Guard Ships Bring Muscle to Sea Disputes
feedItems.description: In most countries, the coast guard focuses on law enforcement and rescue. In China, it focuses on enforcing Beijing’s contested maritime claims—with two massive ships leading the charge.

feedItems.title: Xi Tells Biden China Is Ready to Work With Incoming Administration
feedItems.description: The two leaders’ final sit-down, at a summit in Peru, is marked by uncertainty over Trump’s tariff threats.

feedItems.title: Host of the COP29 Climate Talks Is Raining on His Own Parade
feedItems.description: Azerbaijani leader Ilham Aliyev has been praising fossil fuel and taking shots at geopolitical rivals, casting a cloud over the climate summit.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
To Merz, the Teuton, fate doth lend,
A task to make his land ascend,
As Trump in yonder West does rove,
In mirthful jest and iron glove.

The ghostly hummingbirds take flight,
In Ukraine's skies, imbued with might,
Not Norse, nor Saxon could erase,
Their deadly dance in the airy space.

Famed Olson, in the court's grand show,
His voice strikes like a longboat's bow,
For equality in love's sweet plight,
A gleaming beacon in the dark night.

feedItems.title: The Man Expected to Lead Germany Is Ready to Strike Deals With Trump
feedItems.description: A win would give Friedrich Merz the daunting task of rebuilding a German economy that hasn’t grown since 2019—and establish him as Europe’s main counterpart to Donald Trump.

feedItems.title: Killer Robots Are About to Fill Ukrainian Skies
feedItems.description: Kyiv’s drone suppliers are ramping up production of computer-guided drones that are cheap to produce and can’t be electronically jammed.

feedItems.title: Ted Olson, a Towering Figure of the Conservative Legal Movement, Dies at 84
feedItems.description: Olson played a pivotal role in striking down affirmative action and securing George W. Bush’s 2000 victory, but called fighting for same-sex marriage ‘the highlight of my life.’
